tasks.task: Understand and reproduce indigenous microorganisms (IMO) for soil health.
subtasks: Identify and harvest appropriate natural sources.
Prepare a suitable container with cooked rice.
Bury the container with harvested IMO and maintain dry conditions for 5 days.
Mix harvested IMO with brown sugar to create IMO2 and store.
Activate IMO3 using water, 5.3 hormones, FPJ, and other inputs.
Create fermented plant juice (FPJ) using local plants and brown sugar.
Combine carbs (e.g., wheat bran) with carbon (e.g., cacao shells) and liquids for aeration.
Turn the mixture daily to manage temperature and moisture, aiming for 120°F max.
Store IMO3 in a breathable container and prepare for future use.
Make liquid IMO with aerated water for soil and plant applications.
Mix native soil with active IMO3 for improved fertility.
Incorporate liquid IMO into soil to enhance microbial diversity.

tasks.task: Manage and maintain a system for IMO production and use.
subtasks: Regularly source local plant matter for FPJ.
Test soil moisture and adjust as needed during IMO3 development.
Document and refine the process based on results and experiences.
